intro: Elleanthus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elleanthus peruvianus is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine by local communities.
